pageContext.description: This appears to be copper or largely so. Dark red metal shows. A channel seems to have been cut partly through, the dotted line indicates its course. If this channel was not cut, it may be where two cakes of metal joined.
pageContext.surface: Clay or earth adheres nearly all over.
pageContext.associations: Found at Little Baddow - Rough Metal (2 pieces), sickle, 7 socketed celts, and a palstave.
pageContext.publications: Trans. Essex Field Club, Vol. II, p. 31,Essex Naturalist, Vol. XVI, p. 246.
pageContext.collection: Private Collection,1924,H. Mothersole Esq.,Warren House, Roxwell Road, Chelmsford
